Package jnet

Class JServerSocket

java.lang.Object
jnet.JServerSocket
public class JServerSocket extends Object
C-style socket wrapper for servers.

  • Method Details

    • bind

      public void bind(String ip, int port, int backlog) throws IOException
      Binds to a given IP address and port. If the bind fails, an error is logged and the IOException is propagated.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address to bind to.
      port - the port to bind to.
      backlog - the number of pending connections to hold onto in a queue.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the java ServerSocket cannot be created.
      See Also:
      • Log

    • accept

      public Socket accept()
      Waits for and accepts an incoming client connection. If an error occurs, a message will be logged.
      Returns:
      a Socket object of the connecting client.
      See Also:
      • Log

    • send

      public int send(byte[] payload, JClientSocket clientConnection)
      Sends a message across the socket to a specific client. This method handles the use of a CRC and header automatically. The argument payload should not contain these elements. If they are present they will be ignored and treated as part of the payload. The argument byte array must also contain at least 1 byte, and abide by any other preconditions demanded by the CRC and Header routines. Upon any server-side error, a message will be logged and -1 will be returned.
      Parameters:
      payload - a byte array to send.
      clientConnection - the client to send to.
      Returns:
      the number of bytes sent, including the length of the attached crc, header, and possible pad bytes.
      See Also:
      • Log
      • CRC
      • Header

    • recv

      public byte[] recv(JClientSocket clientConnection)
      Receives bytes across the socket. If the read could not be performed or either the header or crc check fails, null is returned and an error is logged. This method validates and detaches the crc and header bytes if valid.

      When reading, Header.SIZE bytes are first read and parsed as a Header.Info object. If the header CRC check passes, Header.Info::size bytes are read. If the CRC check passes for this body, the payload is returned.

      Parameters:
      clientConnection - the client to receive from
      Returns:
      the latest message in the client's buffer.
      See Also:
      • Log
